content: watermelon baby hat size newborn to approx 3 months = 33cm 13 circumference 14cm 5½ from brim to top features o hat to match stitchylinda s watermelon baby cardigan o knitted in the round in one piece from the brim up materials 4mm x 40cm 16 circular knitting needle or magic loop or dpns 25g pink or red double knitting yarn small amounts cream and green double knitting yarn i used james c brett cotton on in pink shade co6 cream shade co2 and variegated lime green shade co20 gauge 22 stitches and 28 row for a 10x10cm 4 x4 gauge square using 4mm needles abbreviations k = knit sts = stitches yo = yarn over k2tog = knit two together decrease ************** making your hat bigger or smaller this should fit an average newborn to 3-month baby but as babies differ in size you may want to make a bigger or smaller hat to make a smaller preemie hat simply cast on 56 stitches or for a larger hat cast on 80 stitches or more just make sure the total is a multiple of 8 stitches then follow the instructions as written you can also make the hat longer or shorter to fit by doing fewer or more plain knit row after round 24 smaller or larger needles or a different weight of yarn will change the size of the hat too nb the dk yarn i used is a cotton mix and knits up slightly bigger than most dk yarns and more like worsted http //www ravelry com/people/stitchylinda ©stitchylinda designs free pattern not for resale instructions with green yarn and 4mm needles using a stretchy cast-on cast on 64 stitches and join in the round placing marker to mark the beginning of the round see note above about making hat bigger or smaller work rounds as follows 1 purl 2 knit 3 purl 4 knit 5 purl change to cream yarn 6 knit 7 knit change to pink yarn 8 knit 9 knit 10 eyelet round k2 yo k2tog then k6 yo k2tog to last 4 sts k4 11- 13 knit 3 rounds 14 eyelet round k6 yo k2tog to end 15-17 knit 3 rounds 18 eyelet round k2 yo k2tog then k6 yo k2tog to last 4 sts k4 19-20 knit 2 rounds 21 eyelet round k6 yo k2tog to end 23-23 knit 2 rounds 24 eyelet round k2 yo k2tog then k6 yo k2tog to last 4 sts k4 knit until hat measures 10cm 4 from cast-on edge this will be approx four more rounds you can make your hat longer or shorter here by doing fewer or more rounds decrease rounds 1 k6 k2tog to end 2 knit 3 k5 k2tog to end 4 knit 5 k4 k2 decrease to end 6 knit 7 k3 k2tog to end 8 knit 9
